intro: Sericocomopsis quadrangula, commonly known as the quadrangular silkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its quadrangular stems and hairy leaves, which are typical features of many species in its family. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
